A4.text: Rodinia formed at c. 1.23 Ga by accretion and collision of fragments produced by breakup of an older supercontinent, Columbia, assembled by global-scale 2.0â€“1.8 Ga collisional events.

A5.text: Valentine & Moores 1970 were probably the first to recognise a Precambrian supercontinent, which they named 'Pangaea I.'
